metadata.Title: CVE-2023-46848 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Squid is vulnerable to Denial of Service, where a remote attacker can perform DoS by sending ftp:// URLs in HTTP Request messages or constructing ftp:// URLs from FTP Native input.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.7').
